author: Sam Warner
title: Avatar to get a comic series tie-in with Dark Horse Comics - Comics
text: As we sit tight for the long-awaited sequels to Avatar, we will have to make do with a new comic book series.The newly announced series will feature "new storylines from the past, present and the future world of Avatar".The project was announced during a Dark Horse Comics panel on Friday (October 9) at New York Comic Con (via The Hollywood Reporter).Director James Cameron talked about the project in a video during the event, revealing the partnership between his own Lightstorm Entertainment production company and Dark Horse Comics."Here at Lightstorm Entertainment, we're in the midst of a massive undertaking," Cameron said. "Three new feature films that will take you back to the world of Avatar and reveal more of the mysteries and wonders of Pandora. Â© 20th Century Fox "But even with three sequels in the works, we still have more stories we want to tell. So Lightstorm will be working in partnership with Dark Horse Comics to reveal new storylines from the past, present and the future world of Avatar."He added: "Fly with me, and we look forward to welcoming you back to the world of Pandora."Three sequels to the 2009 film Avatar are in production, with the first set to be released on Christmas Day 2017.Stars Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana and Sigourney Weaver are all set to appear in the sequels.Disney is also set to open an Avatar-themed land called Pandora: The World of Avatar in Florida's Animal Kingdom park, which will open to coincide with the release of Avatar 2 in 2017.
